title: Opioids Are Dragging on Pharma Stocks. It Could Take Even Longer to Resolve.
text:
After years of waiting, it could take a little longer for some certainty to emerge in the opioid litigation.

In a note out Tuesday morning, an analyst at Guggenheim argued that the first trial in the vast federal proceeding known as the opioid multi-district litigation may not kick off as scheduled in late October. “We believe there is an increasing likelihood that the Judge could delay the start of the trial to give the negotiating parties more time to work out a settlement,” Guggenheim’s Glen Santangelo wrote.
